section.title: Deckwash
section.para: The ship's deckwash system serves two auto-stop hose connector outlets located on the aft-deck and fore-deck lockers.
Both outlets are fed with fresh water from the ship's pressurised domestic water system, but the aft outlet can be reconfigured to supply raw water.

section.title: Using raw water at the aft deckwash outlet
section.para: To use raw water at the aft deckwash outlet:

listitem.para: Close the freshwater shut-off valve located on the engine-room deckhead just aft of the engine-room hatch.
Open the through-hull sea cock supplying the chiller unit raw water intake.
Open the deckwash pump supply valve on the output side of the raw water intake filter.
Switch on the D.WASH switch at the helm to enable the deckwash pump.

section.para: The deckwash pump is self-priming and will operate automatically to maintain pressure at the deckwash aft outlet.
To avoid the possibility of leak you should switch off the deckwash pump when it is not in use.

To avoid the possibility of raw water contaminating the ship's freshwater system you must ensure that freshwater shut-off valve is closed when the raw water pump is in use. An automatic double-check valve provides a passive fallback, but it is best not to rely on this as the primary means of isolation.

section.title: Winterisation
section.para: In freezing weather, the above deck pipework should be drained down through the bleed and isolation valves located in the engine room and the master cabin wardrobe.
